splash.usernameTooShort: Username must be at least 3 characters
splash.passwordTooShort: Password must be at least 3 characters

help.introDesc: Stock Analyzer is a professional-grade stock data analysis tool for individual investors. It integrates real-time market monitoring, in-depth technical indicator analysis, AI intelligent price prediction, similarity matching, and portfolio management to assist your investment decisions with data-driven insights.
help.feature1: Real-time Quotes & Multi-dim Charts: Supports intraday, daily/weekly/monthly K-lines, and adjusted prices.
help.feature2: Professional Indicators: Built-in MA, MACD, RSI, KDJ, Bollinger Bands, etc., with customizable parameters.
help.feature3: AI Prediction: Uses LSTM, ARIMA, and other algorithms to forecast future price trends.
help.feature4: Similarity Matching: Searches historical big data for patterns most similar to recent trends to deduce future paths.
help.feature5: Chip Distribution: Visualizes profit/loss chips to accurately identify support and resistance levels.
help.feature6: Portfolio Management: Tracks transaction details, automatically calculates P&L, and generates asset distribution charts.
help.gettingStartedDesc:
1. Search Stock: Enter stock code or name in the search box at the top of the left sidebar, click result to add to favorites.
2. View Details: Click a stock in the favorites list to open its detailed analysis page in the workspace.
3. Switch Period: Toggle between Daily, Weekly, Monthly, or Intraday charts using the toolbar above the K-line chart.
4. Add Indicators: Click the 'Settings' icon or right analysis panel to enable MACD, RSI, etc.
5. AI Analysis: Click the 'AI Analysis' tab on the right to view price predictions and risk assessment reports.
help.interfaceSidebarDesc: The left sidebar is your stock management center. Here you can search/add stocks, create custom groups (e.g., 'Core Holdings', 'Watchlist'), and drag-and-drop to sort. Right-click a stock to delete or move it.
help.interfaceWorkspaceDesc: The workspace supports multi-tab display. You can open analysis pages for multiple stocks simultaneously and switch quickly via top tabs. Each page includes the main K-line chart, sub-indicator area, and volume chart.
help.interfaceToolbarDesc: Provides global function access, including view toggles (sidebar show/hide), fullscreen mode, global refresh, and system settings.
help.interfaceRightPanelDesc:
Offers in-depth analysis tools, including:
- Basic Info: Real-time data like Open, Close, High, Low, Volume.
- AI Prediction: Shows prediction results and confidence levels from multiple models.
- Chip Distribution: Visualizes chip peaks to analyze main cost areas.
help.maDetail:
MA smooths out price data by creating a constantly updated average price to identify the trend direction.
- SMA (Simple Moving Average): Equal weight to all prices.
- EMA (Exponential Moving Average): More weight to recent prices, more responsive.
- Usage: Short-term MA crossing above long-term MA is a 'Golden Cross' (Buy); otherwise 'Death Cross' (Sell). Bullish alignment (Short>Medium>Long) indicates an uptrend.
help.macdDetail:
MACD reveals changes in the strength, direction, momentum, and duration of a trend.
- Components: DIF (Fast), DEA (Slow), MACD Histogram.
- Usage: DIF crossing above DEA is a Golden Cross. Histogram turning from green to red indicates strengthening bullish momentum. Divergence (price high, MACD low) signals potential reversal.
help.rsiDetail:
RSI measures the speed and change of price movements to analyze market sentiment.
- Range: 0-100.
- Usage: RSI > 70 is considered Overbought (Risk); RSI < 30 is Oversold (Opportunity). Hovering around 50 indicates a sideways market.
help.kdjDetail:
KDJ combines momentum, relative strength, and moving averages to study the relationship between high/low and closing prices.
- Components: K, D, J lines.
- Usage: J > 100 Overbought, J < 0 Oversold. K crossing above D is a Golden Cross. KDJ is very sensitive to short-term fluctuations.
help.bollingerDetail:
Consists of a middle band (20-day MA) and two outer bands (standard deviations).
- Usage: Price touching upper band suggests pullback pressure; lower band suggests support. Bands narrowing (squeeze) predicts high volatility ahead.
help.chipDetail:
Shows the volume of shares held at different price levels.
- Single Peak: High concentration, often marks end of accumulation or distribution. Low-level single peak is a strong buy signal.
- Multi Peak: Trapped supply above, profit below; price often oscillates between peaks.
- Profit Ratio: Percentage of chips held below current price.
help.aiPredictionDetail:
Integrates advanced algorithms for price forecasting:
- LSTM: Captures long-term non-linear dependencies in time series.
- ARIMA: Classic statistical model for linear trends and seasonality.
- Linear/Polynomial Regression: Identifies basic trend directions.
Note: Predictions are for reference. The confidence interval (shaded area) shows the probable range.
help.similarityDetail:
Searches historical database for patterns most similar to recent trends (e.g., last 20 days).
- Principle: 'History repeats itself'. Infers potential future paths based on how similar historical patterns played out.
- Fan Chart: Shows a collection of subsequent trends from matched history to assess probability distribution.
help.backtestDetail:
Validates trading strategies using historical data.
- Settings: Configure initial capital, commission, stop loss/take profit, and strategy parameters.
- Report: Generates metrics like Total Return, Max Drawdown (Risk), Win Rate, Sharpe Ratio to help optimize strategies.
help.portfolioDetail:
Full-featured asset management module.
- Positions: Manually log buy/sell trades; auto-calculates avg cost and quantity.
- P&L Analysis: Real-time floating P&L and return calculations.
- Cash Flow: Records deposits/withdrawals to track net asset value.
- Visualization: Pie charts for asset allocation.
help.aboutDesc: Professional-grade data analysis tool for individual investors. Open source project, contributions welcome.

settings.title: Settings
settings.fontFamilyDesc: Select the font family used by the application
settings.fontSizeDesc: Set the base font size for the application (10-20px)
settings.numberFontFamilyDesc: Font used for displaying prices, changes, volumes and other numbers
settings.defaultCommissionRateDesc: Default commission rate for backtesting and analysis (A-share standard: 0.0003 means 0.03%, i.e., 3 per 10,000)
settings.defaultCommissionDesc: Default commission amount (¥) when adding transaction records
settings.chipPriceBinsDesc: Number of price bins for chip distribution calculation
settings.chipDecayFactorDesc: Decay factor for chip distribution (0.95 means 5% decay per day)

heatmap.leftYAxis: Left Y-axis: Change % | Right Y-axis: Price (¥) | Red=Change % | Blue=Price
heatmap.bubbleSubtext: X-axis: Market Cap (log) | Y-axis: Change % | Bubble Size: Volume | Color: PE Ratio
heatmap.sortHighToLow: Sorted by value from high to low
heatmap.matrixSubtext: Row=Indicator Type | Column=Stock | Color Depth=Normalized Value (green=low, yellow=mid, red=high)
heatmap.radarSubtext: Shows TOP5 stocks relative performance in 5 dimensions (normalized to 0-100)
heatmap.scatterSubtext: X-axis: Market Cap (log scale, for comparing different sizes) | Y-axis: Change % | Bubble Size: Volume | Color: Change %

workspace.empty: No stock selected. Click a stock from the left sidebar to view details.

chart.title: Chart
chart.loadFailed: Chart loading failed, please refresh the page

analysis.optimizationHint: Select a strategy and click 'Run Optimization' to find the best parameters.
analysis.optimizationDesc: The system will test various parameter combinations and show the top performing sets based on Sharpe Ratio.
analysis.title: Technical Analysis
analysis.noSectorsFound: No related sectors found. (If you just updated, please restart the backend)
analysis.macdStrongBuy: First golden cross above zero axis - Strongest buy signal
analysis.macdGoodBuy: Golden cross above zero axis - Good buy signal
analysis.macdWeakBuy: Golden cross below zero axis - Rebound buy signal
analysis.macdGoodSell: Death cross above zero axis - Good sell signal
analysis.macdStrongSell: Death cross below zero axis - Strongest sell signal
analysis.macdReducing: Red histogram shrinking - Top warning signal
analysis.compositeStrongBuy: MACD Golden Cross + RSI Oversold - Strong buy signal
analysis.compositeBuy: MACD Golden Cross + RSI Neutral - Buy signal
analysis.compositeStrongSell: MACD Death Cross + RSI Overbought - Strong sell signal
analysis.compositeSell: MACD Death Cross + RSI Neutral - Sell signal
analysis.compositeCautionBuy: MACD Golden Cross + RSI Overbought - Caution buy (possible pullback)
analysis.compositeCautionSell: MACD Death Cross + RSI Oversold - Caution sell (possible bounce)
analysis.kdjGoldenCross: K crossing above D - Golden cross
analysis.kdjDeathCross: K crossing below D - Death cross
analysis.nearUpperBand: Near upper band - Watch for pullback
analysis.nearLowerBand: Near lower band - Watch for bounce
analysis.overlayDescSMA: Simple Moving Averages showing trend direction
analysis.overlayDescEMA: Exponential Moving Averages for faster response
analysis.overlayDescBollinger: Bollinger Bands showing volatility and support/resistance
analysis.overlayDescVWAP: Volume Weighted Average Price for institutional reference
analysis.overlayDescGann: Gann Dynamic Square of 9, support/resistance levels based on mathematical spiral
analysis.overlayDescBBPercent: Bollinger Bands %B shows price position within Bollinger Bands, above 80% overbought, below 20% oversold
analysis.oscillatorDescKDJ: KDJ shows momentum and overbought/oversold conditions
analysis.oscillatorDescMomentum: Momentum indicator shows price change rate, positive values indicate upward momentum, negative values indicate downward momentum
analysis.oscillatorDescCCI: CCI shows price relative position, above +100 overbought, below -100 oversold, used to identify trend reversals
analysis.oscillatorDescADX: ADX measures trend strength, +DI and -DI show direction, above 25 indicates strong trend, used to determine trend reliability
analysis.oscillatorDescDMI: DMI Directional Movement Index, +DI shows upward directional strength, -DI shows downward directional strength, used to determine trend direction
analysis.oscillatorDescStochRSI: Stochastic RSI applies stochastic oscillator to RSI values, provides more sensitive overbought/oversold signals, above 80 overbought, below 20 oversold
analysis.oscillatorDescBBPercent: Bollinger Bands %B shows price position within Bollinger Bands, above 80% overbought, below 20% oversold
analysis.signalDesc:
Golden Cross: MA5 crosses above MA10 (Bullish)
Death Cross: MA5 crosses below MA10 (Bearish)
analysis.chipDistributionDesc: Avg Cost: {avgCost}, Profit Ratio: {profitRatio}%, Concentration: {concentration}%, Peaks: {peakCount}, Position: {position}
analysis.chipLowSinglePeak: Low Single Peak - High Rally Probability
analysis.chipHighSinglePeak: High Single Peak - Watch for Fake Breakout

chipPredictionReasoning.lowSingleDense: Low single peak dense: Classic bottom accumulation signal
chipPredictionReasoning.highSingleDenseHighProfit: High single peak with high profit: Risk of distribution/dump
chipPredictionReasoning.highSingleDense: High single peak: Trend continuation possible but risky
chipPredictionReasoning.bottomConverging: Bottom converging: Chips collecting at lows, stabilizing
chipPredictionReasoning.multiPeak: Multi-peak: Divergence in consensus, likely volatile/sideways
chipPredictionReasoning.scattered: Scattered chips: No clear consensus, weak trend support
chipPredictionReasoning.extremelyHighProfit: Extremely high profit ratio (>90%): Strong trend but overbought risk
chipPredictionReasoning.extremelyLowProfit: Extremely low profit ratio (<10%) at lows: Potential oversold bounce
chipPredictionReasoning.heavyTrappedSupply: Heavy trapped supply (>80%): Strong overhead resistance
chipPredictionReasoning.priceAboveCost20: Price 20% above avg cost: Profit taking likely
chipPredictionReasoning.priceBelowCost20: Price 20% below avg cost: Valuation attractive
chipPredictionReasoning.highConcentration: High chip concentration: Strong consensus, explosive move likely

analysis.low_single_dense_tactics: Low single dense + highly concentrated + low profit chips: volume breakout is a classic start signal
analysis.high_single_dense_tactics: High single dense: watch for fake breakout and distribution, trade with caution
analysis.high_dense_high_profit_tactics: High dense + profit>80%: high volume without rally is typical distribution, high risk
analysis.multi_peak_tactics: Multi peak: high divergence, sideways likely, direction unclear
analysis.scattered_tactics: Scattered: no strong hands, avoid or trade short-term only
analysis.bottom_converging_tactics: Bottom multi-to-single peak: accumulation尾声, stronger buy signal
analysis.high_profit_tactics: Profit>70%: rally may stall, avoid chasing
analysis.high_trapped_tactics: Trapped>60%: heavy overhead supply, wait for turnover
analysis.highly_concentrated_tactics: Concentration<12%: lock-up or washout end, focus on breakout
analysis.neutral_tactics: Balanced longs/shorts, moderate pattern; observe and decide with volume/price
analysis.epochsDesc: Number of training iterations (current version is simplified)
analysis.learningRateDesc: Model learning rate (current version is simplified)

price_change.name: Price Change Rate

ema_cross.name: EMA Cross
ema_cross.description: Difference between fast and slow EMA, for identifying crossover signals

chip.decayFactorDesc: Higher factor retains more historical chips (lower turnover)
chip.decayCoefficientDesc: Decay coefficient A in dynamic decay method, used to adjust the impact of turnover rate on chip distribution
chip.decayMethodDesc: Fixed Decay: uses fixed decay factor; Dynamic Decay: turnover rate-based dynamic decay algorithm
chip.distributionTypeDesc: Uniform: evenly distributed between high and low; Triangular: triangular distribution between high, low and average price

similarity.title: Historical K-Line Similarity Matching & Prediction
similarity.explanation: Predict future trends by searching for the most similar historical K-line patterns. For reference only, not investment advice.
